snippet: More than 500,000 people in Pennsylvania and Maryland went a second day without electricity on Thursday after heavy ice felled trees and damaged electrical equipment.
abstract: More than 500,000 people in Pennsylvania and Maryland endure a second day without electricity as utilities scramble to restore power after heavy ice felled trees and damaged electrical equipment.
lead_paragraph: More than 500,000 people in Pennsylvania and Maryland went a second day without electricity on Thursday after heavy ice felled trees and damaged electrical equipment.

headline.main: Power Failures Are Still Widespread After Storm
headline.print_headline: Power Failures Are Still Widespread After Storm
